citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The food preparation area for the dogs had an accumulation of egg shells, trash, and junk. An unclean food preparation
area prevents good husbandry practices. It may facilitate the spread of disease amongst the dogs. The food preparation
area must be cleaned up. Correct by 5/9/25.

A complete physical exam of all the adult dogs has not been completed in the past year. Not having the physical exams
completed doesn't ensure that adequate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have the
Attending Veterinarian conduct annual exams on all the adult dogs. Correct by 6/8/25.

Approximately 15 of the male adult dogs are not current on their distemper and parvo vaccines. In addition, no dogs have
been sampled for heartworm or fecal parasites in the past year. Not vaccinating all adults dogs and not sampling the adult
dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adult dogs
must be vaccinated for distemper and parvo and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from the
Attending Veterinarian. Correct by 6/8/25.

Two dogs require ear cleaning. An adult male Cavalier King Charles Spaniel ("Jason", microchip # 900164001691502)
had a left ear with a large buildup of thick black material caked around the outer ear flap with a mild foul odor. The ear
canal was unable to be observed due to the large amount of brown material. The ear flap skin was red. The right ear had
a mild excess of dark brown material. An adult Male Shih Tzu, named “Gary” (microchip number #900164001981224) had
a mildly red outer ear with a buildup of greasy brown material. The hair in both ear canals is clumped with brown material
obstructing the view of the inner ear.
The licensee did not notice the dirty ears. The licensee mentioned "Jason" had a cleaning about 1 year ago most recently,
but has a history of ear problems. The licensee could not remember the last time "Gary" had an ear cleaning. The
licensee’s program of veterinary care specifies that the ears should be cleaned as frequently “as needed”, with "daily
checking."
Failing to monitor and clean ears on a regular basis can lead to ear infections, itching, and pain.
Preventative care and treatment needs to be taken to ensure the ears are cleaned as per the instructions of the program
of veterinary care. Correct by 5/9/25.

One rabbit was housed in an enclosure with two guinea pigs. Another enclosure contained six guinea pigs and one rabbit.
A third enclosure contained one guinea pig and one rabbit. Rabbits should not be housed with other species unless for
scientific reasons. Housing rabbits with other animals may have a negative impact on the health and well-being of either
animal, due to the potential spread of diseases between species and risk of injury. The licensee shall ensure that rabbits
are not housed in the same primary enclosure with other species. Correct by 5/9/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with ______.
Additional Inspectors:
Alexandra Friedman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The food preparation area for the dogs had an accumulation of egg shells, trash, and junk. An unclean food preparation 
area prevents good husbandry practices. It may facilitate the spread of disease amongst the dogs. The food preparation 
area must be cleaned up. Correct by 5/9/25. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A complete physical exam of all the adult dogs has not been completed in the past year. Not having the physical exams 
completed doesn't ensure that adequate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have the 
Attending Veterinarian conduct annual exams on all the adult dogs. Correct by 6/8/25. 
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Approximately 15 of the male adult dogs are not current on their distemper and parvo vaccines. In addition, no dogs have 
been sampled for heartworm or fecal parasites in the past year. Not vaccinating all adults dogs and not sampling the adult 
dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adult dogs 
must be vaccinated for distemper and parvo and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from the 
Attending Veterinarian. Correct by 6/8/25. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Two dogs require ear cleaning. An adult male Cavalier King Charles Spaniel ("Jason", microchip # 900164001691502) 
had a left ear with a large buildup of thick black material caked around the outer ear flap with a mild foul odor. The ear 
canal was unable to be observed due to the large amount of brown material. The ear flap skin was red. The right ear had 
a mild excess of dark brown material. An adult Male Shih Tzu, named “Gary” (microchip number #900164001981224) had 
a mildly red outer ear with a buildup of greasy brown material. The hair in both ear canals is clumped with brown material 
obstructing the view of the inner ear.  
 
The licensee did not notice the dirty ears. The licensee mentioned "Jason" had a cleaning about 1 year ago most recently,

but has a history of ear problems. The licensee could not remember the last time "Gary" had an ear cleaning. The 
licensee’s program of veterinary care specifies that the ears should be cleaned as frequently “as needed”, with "daily 
checking." 
 
Failing to monitor and clean ears on a regular basis can lead to ear infections, itching, and pain.  
 
Preventative care and treatment needs to be taken to ensure the ears are cleaned as per the instructions of the program 
of veterinary care. Correct by 5/9/25. 
3.58(a) 
   
Classification and separation. 
One rabbit was housed in an enclosure with two guinea pigs. Another enclosure contained six guinea pigs and one rabbit. 
A third enclosure contained one guinea pig and one rabbit. Rabbits should not be housed with other species unless for 
scientific reasons. Housing rabbits with other animals may have a negative impact on the health and well-being of either 
animal, due to the potential spread of diseases between species and risk of injury. The licensee shall ensure that rabbits 
are not housed in the same primary enclosure with other species. Correct by 5/9/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with ______. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Alexandra Friedman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
